p: Along with the accumulation of point mutations, recombination is a powerful mechanism strongly influencing the evolution and epidemiology of human NoVs [ 49]. Recombination observed in feline NoVs has also been described for canine NoVs [ 45, 47]. In all the cases, the site of recombination was mapped to the highly conserved ORF1/ORF2 junction region. Accordingly, a definitive characterization of the strains circulating in carnivores should rely on the sequence analysis of either RdRp region of the ORF2 gene.
